::: {.unit-overview}
# Overview

This unit provides resources for learning more about Git, GitHub, and common workflows. Use it as a reference when you get stuck.

:::
<!-- end unit-overview div -->

::: {.unit-goals}
# Goals

* Know where to find official Git and GitHub documentation.
* Identify beginner-friendly tutorials and cheat sheets.
* Locate help when you run into issues.

:::
<!-- end unit-goals div -->

::: {.unit-reading}
# Reading

## Official documentation

The best starting points are the official docs:

- [GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/)
- [Pro Git book](https://git-scm.com/book)

## Cheat sheets and quick references

- [GitHub Education Git cheat sheet](https://education.github.com/git-cheat-sheet-education.pdf)
- [Atlassian Git tutorials](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials)

## Community help

- [Stack Overflow: git](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/git)
- [Stack Overflow: github](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/github)

## Visual learning

- [GitHub Learning Lab (archived but useful)](https://lab.github.com/)
- [Oh My Git!](https://ohmygit.org/) for an interactive intro

:::
<!-- end unit-reading div -->


::: {.unit-summary}
# Summary

Keep these resources handy. When Git/GitHub gets confusing, the official docs and cheat sheets usually provide the fastest answers.

:::
<!-- end unit-summary div -->


::: {.unit-resources}
# Further Resources

If you find another resource that is especially clear or helpful, please share it so we can keep this list current.

:::
<!-- end unit-resources div -->
